summary:
My experience in multiple disciplines of chemistry, common sense and analytical thinking make me good innovator in the field of chemical sciences. My easy communication and ability to make bonds across teams and cultures help me to work, lead and coordinate across teams. My personal drive and enthusiasm that drives me every day to achieve and to set bigger goals. I have developed feasible commercial processes in chemical industry, (7 granted and 2 filed patents)  and have produced excellent scientific publications in reputed journals. I am recipient of Senior Research Fellowship (SRF), Govt. of India and Alexander van Humboldt (AvH) research fellowship from Federal republic of Germany. Secured first in my Master’s degree  in Physical chemistry specialization and stood first at Ph D entrance examination.

I enjoy reading and learning history, language and culture apart from sciences. I like to spend good amount of time with my family. My great excitation  in  my work is the identification of problems and the discovery of simple solutions whether it is an improved process or an improved method. My objective is to work in a challenging research and development environment that takes advantage of my skills , experience of working at industry with innovation as major driver.
•	Proven track record in handling research projects from ideation at academic institute to practice (commercialization) at Industry.
•	Experience in working as lead scientist across research teams, internal and external IP departments and R&D administration.
•	Program research, development, planning and evaluation
•	Demonstrated abilities in catalyst design and synthesis, characterization
•	Conversant in both heterogeneous and homogeneous catalysis
•	Good Intellectual property (IP) background. Experience in all aspects of innovation, they include ideation, IP rights, capitalization and valorization aspects
•	Experience in working inorganic, and organic chemistries and material science

authors.headline: Research Associate at Florida A&M University

profile_positions.description: Strengthen the IP portfolio, Freedom to operate, IP gate keeping, IP training and Process research and development
profile_positions.title: IP focal point at PT&D

profile_positions.description:
Goal is to strengthen the Patent portfolio and Freedom to operate of the processes & products of business divisions supported by Process Technology & Development (PT&D) division. Specific functions are as follows :

•	Established and coordinated a new IP gate keeping  (or watch list) procedure for 9 technologies across 3 business divisions in liaison with patent analyst and subject matter experts
•	Developed and facilitated IP council and its meetings for two business divisions  to strengthen the patent portfolios
•	Helping with the ideation and generation of new projects 
•	Assisting to the researchers, technologists, and managers on capitalization of IP and further to develop the processes.
•	Worked closely with Research and business Managers in decision making on different issues
•	Preparation of invention disclosures,  drafting the patents, assisting the patent attorneys in the  preparation of office responses 
•	Worked as liaison between patent analyst and Managers for patent search studies to establish the patentability and freedom to operate.
•	Acted as contact point for the IP matters of Process Technology and Development (PT&D) division for 50 skilled researchers and technologists.
•	Established online IP training for PT&D division followed by  IP workshop on subjects such as IP basics, patent searches,  patent reading and patent strategy
profile_positions.title: IP focal point  at Process Technology and Development (PT&D) division

profile_positions.description:
Process development of a new process is undertaken with the goal of commercialization. I have invented this catalytic process at Leiden university as postdoctoral researcher. Specific functions are as follows:

•	Established bench scale studies and demonstrated the catalytic process that was developed at Leiden University
•	Acted as lead researcher/scientist in a  team of 4 researchers involved in the studies from lab to pilot scale studies 
•	Understand catalyst system, modifications to obtain maximum catalyst activity
•	Up to date with literature and patent searches around the catalyst, process and process conditions
•	Conducted basic experimental studies to produce different industrially important epoxy compounds (including monomers to epoxy resins).
•	Established Inline UV-Vis spectroscopic studies as part of mechanistic studies to understand the catalytic active species 
•	Initiated the use of Inline Raman spectroscopic studies to determine the reactant and products of the process
•	Planning, execution and evaluation of the experiments 
•	Worked closely with the Analytical support group for the qualitative and quantitate analyses of reactants, products and byproducts of the process
•	Analyzing the results, and reporting. Microsoft Office, Visio, ISIS draw and TIBCO soft wares are extensively.
•	Worked closely with our collaborators (third party ) in the pilot scale studies of this process
•	Prepared invention disclosures and worked together with the attorneys to prepare the patent applications

•	Certified Six sigma Green belt in process research, and experienced in working DoE. Exprienced in working safety procedures such as HAZOP and PSA procedures
•	Learned and used theTRIZ (innovation) methodology for solving the problems of  process research.
profile_positions.title: Process Researcher

profile_positions.description:
•	Literature search to select epoxidation catalysts for epoxidaiton of electron-poor olefins
•	Collaborated with industries as well as Universities to obtain the selected catalysts 
•	Prepared heterogeneous Ti-SiO2 catalysts via chemical vapor deposition (CVD) method
•	Planned, executed and evaluated experiments of the epoxidation of various olefins with different  homogeneous and heterogeneous Mo, Ti, W, and Mn catalysts 
•	GC, GC-MS and NMR are used regularly for the analyses of the organic compounds
•	Guided a bachelor student to complete his project
•	Results are analyzed and presented at frequent intervals to Industry sponsors and users committee members
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral researcher

company.name: ACA Instiute for Applied Chemistry Adlershof Berlin

profile_positions.description:
Project goal was to develop novel Redox molecular sieves for selective oxidation reactions. Specific functions are described as follows:
•	Research project is prepared and for this achieved AvH fellowship to conduct the research in Federal Republic of Germany
•	Attempts were made to synthesize novel Metallo(W and Se) silicates via hydrothermal (or sol-gel) synthesis
•	XRD, and FTIR are used for the analysis of materials, while GC and GC-MS are used for the analysis of organic compounds
•	Newly prepared catalysts are tested for the oxidation of cyclohexene to adipic acid  
•	Got training in German language
profile_positions.title: Alexander van Humboltz Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
•	Novel Pt/PVP/MCM-41 and Ag/PVP/MCM-41 nano composites are prepared via core-shell approach.
•	CTAB was used for self-assembly to prepare the inorganic shell around the Pt nano particle.
•	HRTEM, TGA, XRD, and FTIR are used to analyze the new materials
•	Hydrogenation reaction was conducted to test the Pt core-shell nano particles.
•	W-SBA-15 was synthesized using triblock copolymers via sol-gel method
•	Oxidation of cyclohexene to adipic acid was conducted to test the W-SBA-15 materials
•	Guided one Ph D and two Master students to complete their assignments
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher
